Lunyu 4.2 子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而無適不然，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Lunyu 4.2 子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而無適不然，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Lunyu 4.2 子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而無適不然，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Lunyu 4.2子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而無適不然，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」
Lunyu .11
Lunyu .11 子謂顏淵曰：「用之則行，舍之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」子路曰：「子行三軍，則誰與？」子曰：「暴虎馮河，死而無悔者，吾不與也。必也臨事而懼，好謀而成者也。」
Lunyu .11 子謂顏淵曰：*****「用之則行，舍之則藏，*****唯我與爾有是夫！」子路曰：「子行三軍，則誰與？」子曰：「暴虎馮河，死而無悔者，吾不與也。必也臨事而懼，好謀而成者也。」
Lunyu 7.11 子謂顏淵曰：*****「用之則行，舍之則藏，*****唯我與爾有是夫！」子路曰：「子行三軍，則誰與？」子曰：「暴虎馮河，死而無悔者，吾不與也。必也臨事而懼，好謀而成者也。」

Lunyu 4.2子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而*****無適不然*****，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Lunyu 4.2子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar im 論語集注 zu 4.:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而*****無適不然*****，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Lunyu 4.2子曰：「不仁者不可以久處約，不可以長處樂。仁者安仁，知者利仁。」Zhu Xis Kommentar im 論語集注 zu 4.2:樂，音洛。知，去聲。○ 約，窮困也。利，猶貪也，蓋深知篤好而必欲得之也。不仁之人，失其本心，久約必濫，久樂必淫。惟仁者則安其仁而*****無適不然*****，知者則利於仁而不易所守，蓋雖深淺之不同，然皆非外物所能奪矣。○ 謝氏曰：「仁者心無內外遠近精粗之間，非有所存而自不亡，非有所理而自不亂，如目視而耳聽，手持而足行也。知者謂之有所見則可，謂之有所得則未可。有所存斯不亡，有所理斯不亂，未能無意也。安仁則一，利仁則二。安仁者非顏閔以上，去聖人為不遠，不知此味也。諸子雖有卓越之才，謂之見道不惑則可，然未免於利之也。」

Liu Xiaogan: ？《淮南子· 天文》曰： ｀｀一而生，故分而為陰陽，陰陽合而萬物生，故曰： ｀－二，二生三，三生萬物。＇＂按其說，一是元初之氣，二即陰陽二氣，三是陰、陽及陰陽合氣。
Virtus aquae exundantis
Liu Xiaogan: 《淮南子· 天文》曰： ｀｀一而生，故分而為陰陽，陰陽合而萬物生，故曰： ｀－二，二生三，三生萬物。＇＂按其說，一是元初之氣，二即陰陽二氣，三是陰、陽及陰陽合氣。 高亨說｀｀一、二、三者，舉虛數以代實物也。一者天地未分之元素，……二者天地也。三者陰氣、陽氣、和氣也。＂ （高亨1957, 96)

arcanely merging with both the brilliant and the dust,
for only then could he manage to avoid appearing either intimate
or aloof

張耿光 90: 我把先生看作天地。 is not exactly very helpful as an explanation of 天地。
陳鼓應2012: 我把先生当作天地，張耿光 90: 我把先生看作天地。 are not exactly very helpful as an explanation of 天地。

陳鼓應：
As for the the true king since he knows what it takes to deal with his subordinates and to govern the hoi polloi.
宣潁云:與天地同樂，而物累皆捐
宣潁云:與天地同樂，而物累皆捐。 王叔岷 457 is more down-to-earth: 謂逍遙於天地之間，而行其所無事也。
陳鼓應：武延绪说：“按‘王’疑‘正’字之讹，本在句末。后人不知其误，又嫌于义未协；故乙于‘天下’之上耳。‘天下’疑当作‘天地’，‘天地正’与‘万物服’对文。下文‘推于天地，通于万物’，正承此而言。”
成玄英：言古之怀道帝王何为者哉？盖无心顺物、德合二仪而巳矣。 陳鼓應：
That which without working on the myriad kinds of things makes the myriad kinds of things arise of themselves,
What without working on the myriad kinds of things makes the myriad kinds of things arise of themselves,
he who without engaging in any assertive administrative action, so that all these administrative actions come to fruition
What without working on (or being one of) the myriad kinds of things makes the myriad kinds of things arise of themselves,
he who without engaging in any assertive administrative action, while all these administrative actions come to fruition
Liezi has
章炳麟说：“‘醇’借为‘准’。地官质人，壹其淳制。《释文》：‘淳，音准。’是其例。《易》曰：‘易与天地准。’配神明，准天地，二句意同。”（《庄子解故》）
陳鼓應：，“取法天地，章炳麟说：“‘醇’借为‘准’。地官质人，壹其淳制。《释文》：‘淳，音准。’是其例。《易》曰：‘易与天地准。’配神明，准天地，二句意同。”（《庄子解故》）

想爾注：吾，道也。我者，吾同。道至尊，常畏患，不敢求榮。思欲損身，彼貪寵之人，身豈能勝道乎！為身而違誡，非也。
想爾注：吾，道也。我者，吾同。道至尊，常畏患，不敢求榮。思欲損身，彼貪寵之人，身豈能勝道乎！為身而違誡，非也。
吾我，道也。志欲無身，但欲養神耳。欲令人自法，故云之。
想爾注：「及我無身，吾有何患。」吾我，道也。志欲無身，但欲養神耳。欲令人自法，故云之。
想爾注：吾，道也。還嘆道美，難可名字，故曰道也。
想爾注：言道甚大。言強者，恐不復不能副其德也。
想爾注：吾，道也。還嘆道美，難可名字，故曰道也。
想爾注：吾，道也。還嘆道美，難可名字，故曰道也。 「吾不知誰子，像帝之先。」吾事，道也。帝先者，亦道也，與無名萬物始同一耳。未知誰家子能行此道，能行者便像道也，似帝先矣。
"When one rests in one's Self
"When one rests in one's Self {JRW: How did you get this translation?}
therefore the did not fall foul of the plans/ideas of Heaven
those who attain to the plans/ideas of Heaven
which just lay in their behavious
2. High Heaven (brings toghether=) masses the clourds,
you should(now) make Wen Wang your pattern;
The appointment not beeing easy (to keep),

pour éloigner ce qui lui est nuisible [§§§§§其所害"what they regard as harmful" is misconstrued in the English and in the French. But, in this case no great harm is done for the 思路 of the passage, except that the Chinese is much more philosophically precise in the context!]

pour éloigner ce qui lui est nuisible [§§§§§其所害"what they regard as harmful" is misconstrued in the English and in the French. 劉康德does not address the grammar：去避开有害的东西， 趋于有益的东西。But, in this case no great harm is done for the 思路 of the passage, except that the Chinese is much more philosophically precise in the context!]

S'il est impossible des suivre les usages anciens [§§§§§不可循"must not be followed" is misinterpreted by the English: surely one CAN mechanically follow constant ancient models, and the trouble is that Confucianists DO recommend following such constant standards. The English misconstrues the very essence of the message of this passage. And the fact that the French in this instance do no better is no excuse. Fascinatingly, the Chinese translators feel they have no problem whatever here, because they can be innocently vague on the philosophically crucial distinction. 許匡一：既然常规不可遵循， 陳廣忠：因此常规不能一成不变去依循， 劉康德：既然常规老套不能死守. This is all very exciting and needs further discussion. 待考]

et de s'appuyer sur les instruments de l'Antiquité, [§§§器械 "contraptions" is generalising: "and if mechanical contraptions cannot be (continuously) relied upon" and does not refer specifically to "martial instruments". §§§也"factive: since, given that (>it having been established above that)" is probably not conditional but rather factive (assuming the truth of the protasis or antecedent) and deriving from it the apodosis introduced by 則.]

comment s'étonner qu'il faille changer et transformer les lois et les mesures des premiers rois. [§§§§有 "in some cases" is important for the argument, and there is no "must be" in the Chinese. The point is that, historically, some "have been" adjusted. §§§§則"then it follows" links two subordinate clauses to one apodosis which concludes from the impossibilities in the two conditional clauses, that there musst have occurred change.]
Les antiques règles

se rapportant aux rites de mariage exigeaient que le futur marié se présentât sous son titre social et non sous son nom propre; [高注: 當婚者之身，不稱其名也，稱諸父兄. The point is that the ritual takes the marriage to be the responsibility of the father and the elder brother, not a matter to be independently decided or conducted by the son.]
or, Shun prit femme sans prévenir son père, [The adversative connection with what precedes is helpfully brought out in the French.]

se rapportant aux rites de mariage exigeaient que le futur marié se présentât sous son titre social et non sous son nom propre; §§§§ 稱 is here crucially "refer to explicitly by his name" He is indirectly referred to as the son of his father or younger brother of his brother.[高注: 當婚者之身，不稱其名也，稱諸父兄. The point is that the ritual takes the marriage to be the responsibility of the father and the elder brother, not a matter to be independently decided or conducted by the son.]
ce qui allait contre les rites. [ 非禮"offends against the rules of ritual" has only one subject: Shun's way of marrying without announcing his marriage to his family.
Les rites voulaient qu'on prît femme à trente ans; [§娶"take a wife" is gender specific, like the French "prendre femme". which is not the same as "se marier".]
ce qui allait contre les lois.
Sous le Xia, le cercueil était placé en haut des degrés [menant à la partie est de l'estrade cérémonielle, devant la salle de réception] [§§§殯 is misinterpreted in the English.]

Sous le Xia, le cercueil était placé en haut des degrés [menant à la partie est de l'estrade cérémonielle, devant la salle de réception] [§§§§§殯 "preliminary coffin" is misinterpreted in the English. DCD: 1.死者入殮后停柩以待葬。

Au temps de You Yu [Shun], on utilisait des cercueils en brique [§§§棺"inner coffin" needs to be distinguished in contexts where both 槨 "outer" and 棺"inner" coffins are under discussion, as we shall see when the 槨 are mentioned below.]
Ce sont là des différences dans les rites. [§此 is not addressed in the English as it is very nicely in the French. "These are points where the rites are not the same"]
Ce sont là des différences dans les rites. [§§§§§此 is not translated in the English as it is very nicely in the French. "These are SOME points where the rites are not the same"]
Ce sont là des différences dans les sépultures. [§§The English does not address the grammar of this sentence as above.]
Au temps des Xia, on sacrifiait apres le coucher du soleil; [§§於闇"in darkness" is after sunset, but probably the evening and not necessarily the night.]
Au temps des Xia, on sacrifiait apres le coucher du soleil; [§§於闇"in darkness" is after sunset, but quite possibly the dark evening and not necessarily the night.]
les Yin sacrifiaient en plein jour;
les Yin sacrifiaient en plein jour; [§陽is "plain daylight".
les Zhou sacrifiaient du lever du soleil jusqu'au soir. [§§Both the French and the English are wrong according to the old commentary: 【高注】於日出時，祭於庭中。朝者庭也。
De son là des différences dans les sacrifices. [§§Here again, as twice before, the English does not address the grammar of this sentence.]
Ce sont là des differences dans les airs de musique. [§§§§樂 §§Here again the English does not address the grammar of this line.]
Ainsi, les cinq empereurs suivirent des dao différents, mais la vertu de chacun d'entre eux couvrit le monde entier.
Les trois rois agirent de façon différente, mais leur renommée se perpétua dans les générations suivantes.
ses doughts se déplaçaient de haut en bas sur l'instrument sans avoir à mesurer les écarts en puces ou en pieds; [without any inch-and-feet measure]
ses doughts se déplaçaient de haut en bas sur l'instrument sans avoir à mesurer les écarts en puces ou en pieds; ["What he was moving up and down was without any inch-and-feet (precise) standard]

ses doughts se déplaçaient de haut en bas sur l'instrument sans avoir à mesurer les écarts en puces ou en pieds; ["What he was moving up and down was without any inch-and-feet (precise) standard. 許匡一 does not try to address the 所：上下移动时并没有拿尺来度量，]

ses doughts se déplaçaient de haut en bas sur l'instrument sans avoir à mesurer les écarts en puces ou en pieds; ["What he was moving up and down was without any inch-and-feet (precise) standard. 許匡一 does not try to address the 所：上下移动时并没有拿尺来度量， 劉康德：上下移动时没有尺度来衡量，]

Si ceus qui ont pénétré les dispositions foncières relatives aux rites et à la musique purent créer [des modèles adaptés à leur époque],[§§§§能作"be capable of being creative". 陳廣忠 gives up on translating the final part of this：因此通达礼乐道理的人才能进行适宜的弹奏。 See 禮記樂記「知禮樂之情者能作。Legge does translate convincingly: therefore they who knew the essential nature of ceremonies and music could frame them. The phrase recurs throughout ancient literature.]

c'est qu'un principe fondamental et inhérent [§§§§言"this means" is not translated in the English. I suggest, along the lines of the French: "this means that there is a basic dominant principle within (ritual and court music)"]

les guidait dans l'application des règles [周"universal"; "and by means of that dominant principle they understand what the (traditional) standards of all kinds are used for/what their function is." It looks to me, at this point, as the fundamentally important abstract conclusion is not brought out in any of the translations. 陳廣忠 is no help for this line: 因此通达礼乐道理的人才能进行适宜的弹奏。The 周 in the old editions is declared to be 不詞 and one is tempted to read 用 instead. 待考]

les guidait dans l'application des règles [周"universal"; "and by means of that dominant principle they understand what the (traditional) standards of all kinds are used for/what their proper function is." It looks to me, at this point, as the fundamentally important abstract conclusion is not brought out in any of the translations. 陳廣忠 is no help for this line: 因此通达礼乐道理的人才能进行适宜的弹奏。The 周 in the old editions is declared to be 不詞 and one is tempted to read 用 instead. 待考]

Le duc Xiao (Les editions courantes écrivent fautivement "duc Zhao de Lu") eut une mère adoptive qui'il aimait. [§§§§慈母"adoptive mother" who is appointed by a ruler, would have to be distinguished from an ordinary (wet)nurse. HYDCD: 2.古稱撫育自己成長的庶母爲慈母。《儀禮·喪服》：“慈母如母。傳曰：慈母者何也?傳曰：妾之無子者，妾子之無母者，父命妾曰：女以爲子；命子曰：女以爲母。若是，則生養之，終其身如母，死則喪之三年如母。” Presumably Duke Xiao must have been his father's son by a concubine who died very early so that his father appointed an "adoptive mother". For thoroughly confusing detailed discussion see 何寧 p. 919ff. 待考]

Quand elle mourut , il porta le bonnet de soie cuite en signe de deuil. [§§§§There is no "on her behalf" explicit or implied in the Chinese. As the French has it, the duke engaged in sartorial formal mourning for that "adoptive mother" by wearing a cap made of special silk.]

Quand elle mourut , il porta le bonnet de soie cuite en signe de deuil. [As the French has it, the duke engaged in sartorial formal mourning for that "adoptive mother" by wearing a cap made of special silk.]
Ainsi naquit le port du vêtement de deuil pour les mères adoptives [慈母"adoptive mother" not "nurse".]
Ainsi naquit le port du vêtement de deuil pour les mères adoptives [§§§§§慈母"adoptive mother" not "nurse". ]
Le marquis de Yang tua le marquis de Liao et enleva sa femme. [侯 is a definite rank, not like the generic "lord"]
Le marquis de Yang tua le marquis de Liao et enleva sa femme. [§§§§侯"conventionally: marquis" is a definite rank, not like the generic "lord". 竊is "abducted" and "take" seems weak, but is OK.]

Ainsi fut abrogé le cérémonial prescrivant que l'épouse tînt le plat de nourriture lorsque l'époux présentait le vin aux grand banquets sacrificiels. [§§§§廢"exclude": what is excluded or abandoned is the originally prescribed ritual presence not "of women", but of the ruler's wife, as the French takes care to elaborate. 夫人"wife; widow" cannot be used generically for "women" as the English assumes.]
quand les pratiques des âges récents [§§末"the latest" are not just any later ages. I suggest "And when it comes to latter-day exploits,"

sont bonnes, on les accepte. [著"promote" does not mean "accept" as the French has it. Pomeranceva's вписывают "write in" is a good try, but this meaning is unattested elsewhere. I suggest the thought is this: "as long as they were good these were (also) celebrated (along with the mythically famous exploits from the time of the Early Kings)."

Ainsi, les cinq empereurs suivirent des dao différents, mais la vertu de chacun d'entre eux couvrit le monde entier. [One notes that in this instance "potency" is distinctly more helpful than the French "vertu" for 德.]

Le duc Xiao (Les editions courantes écrivent fautivement "duc Zhao de Lu") eut une mère adoptive qui'il aimait. [§§§§慈母"adoptive mother" who is appointed by a ruler, would have to be distinguished from an ordinary (wet)nurse. HYDCD: 2.古稱撫育自己成長的庶母爲慈母。《儀禮·喪服》：“慈母如母。傳曰：慈母者何也?傳曰：妾之無子者，妾子之無母者，父命妾曰：女以爲子；命子曰：女以爲母。若是，則生養之，終其身如母，死則喪之三年如母。” Presumably Duke Xiao must have been his father's son by a concubine who died very early so that his father appointed an "adoptive mother". For meticulous discussion see 何寧 p. 919ff. 待考]

Le duc Xiao (Les editions courantes écrivent fautivement "duc Zhao de Lu") eut une mère adoptive qui'il aimait. [慈母perhaps "adoptive mother" who is appointed by a ruler, would have to be distinguished from an ordinary (wet)nurse. HYDCD: 2.古稱撫育自己成長的庶母爲慈母。《儀禮·喪服》：“慈母如母。傳曰：慈母者何也?傳曰：妾之無子者，妾子之無母者，父命妾曰：女以爲子；命子曰：女以爲母。若是，則生養之，終其身如母，死則喪之三年如母。” Presumably Duke Xiao must have been his father's son by a concubine who died very early so that his father appointed an "adoptive mother". For meticulous discussion see 何寧 p. 919ff. 待考]

Ainsi naquit le port du vêtement de deuil pour les mères adoptives [§§§§§慈母"adoptive mother" not "nurse". §§§§慈母之服 "mourning garments to be worn for the mourning for one's adoptive mother" is syntactically misunderstood in the English. The garments are not for nurses.]

Ainsi naquit le port du vêtement de deuil pour les mères adoptives [§§§§慈母之服 "mourning garments to be worn for the mourning for one's nurse/adoptive mother" is syntactically misconstrued in the English. The garments are not for nurses.]

Le marquis de Yang tua le marquis de Liao et enleva sa femme. [§§§§侯"conventionally: marquis" is a definite rank, not like the generic "lord". 竊is "abducted" and in the English translation "take" seems weak, but is OK.]

Ainsi fut abrogé le cérémonial prescrivant que l'épouse tînt le plat de nourriture lorsque l'époux présentait le vin aux grand banquets sacrificiels. [§§§§廢"exclude" is not to politely "excuse": what is excluded or abandoned is the originally prescribed ritual presence not "of women", but of the ruler's wife, as the French takes care to elaborate. 夫人"wife; widow" cannot be used generically for "women" as the English assumes.]
Ainsi les rites et la musique ne sont jamais immuables.
si l'administration et l'éducation ont un principe,
Si l'on veut veut le bien-être du peuple, [§§§§苟"if really" seems to be unknown to the English translators. I suggest: "If something really is of benefit..." There is no investigating implied.
on n'a pas à prendre modèle sur l'Antiquité. [§不必"there is no need to" seems to fit better into the argument, but the "not necessarily" is worth considering.
si l'on veut mener à bien les affaires [§§§§周於"be comprehensively helpful (to the task)" remains unappreciated in the English. §§§§苟 is again mistranslated.]

Si l'on veut veut le bien-être du peuple, [§§§苟"if really" makes an emphatic conditional, not an ordinary conditional. I suggest: "If something really is of benefit..." §§§§§§ There is no investigating implied in this clause.

on n'a pas à suivre le passé [舊"old precedent" is not well rendered by the unspecific English "the old". 高注 brings out the point very nicely:舊，常也。傳曰：「舊不必良。」 Gao seems to have read 不必 as in "there is no need to follow long-prevailing practice."]

C'est pour avoir refusé d'imiter les époques précédentes [§§§§§王"became kings" is inchoative here, as often elsewhere, and the "ruled" in the English does not get the dynamics of the transition from one dynasty to the next. ]

C'est pour avoir refusé d'imiter les époques précédentes [§§§§§§王"became kings" is inchoative here, as often elsewhere, and the "ruled" in the English does not get the dynamics of the transition from one dynasty to the next. "and so suited their circumstances" is an addition that is not in the Chinese text.]
Ainsi, changer l'ancient n'est pas nécessairement condamnable, [§§§未"not necessarily" is not brought into the English.]

ni suivre les coutumes nécessairement louable. [§§§未"not necessarily" is not brought into the English. §§§§多"esteem highly/praise" is misunderstood as "excessive" in the English. 商君書：。然則反古者未必可非，循禮者未足多也。」陳廣忠 does not get the nuance of 未, but he does get the obvious meaning of 多"esteem highly, praise" here: 因此改变古制元可非议，而依循旧俗不值得赞美。]

ni suivre les coutumes nécessairement louable. [§§§未"not necessarily" is not brought into the English. §§§§多"esteem highly/praise" is misunderstood as "excessive" in the English. 商君書：。然則反古者未必可非，循禮者未足多也。」陳廣忠 does not get the nuance of 未, but he does get the obvious meaning of 多"esteem highly, praise" right: 因此改变古制元可非议，而依循旧俗不值得赞美。]
Ainsi, changer l'ancient n'est pas nécessairement condamnable, [§§未"not necessarily, not in and of itself" is not brought into the English.]
Les cent rivières ont chacune une source différente, mais toutes se reoighent dans la mer;

les cent familles ont chacune un métier différent, mais toutes contribues à l'ordre social. [§§§家"thinkers" is anachronistically misunderstood in the English as "lineages of learning". Here the French does not seem capture the force of 務"aspire to, work towards" or of 家"thinkers". ]

Pour admirables que soient les enseignements du Shijing et du Chunqiu, [顧遷：雖然是学问中的上等 ; 陳廣忠：《诗》、《春秋》． 都是学问中精美的东西，§§§§學之美者"are the most splendid objects of study" is misconstrued in the English which does not address the grammar of the sentence at all. But where English language translators flounder, the Chinese translators still see no superlative. Perhaps there is none? The French offers a most elegant solution.]

Comment pourraient ils égaler la plénitude des trois dynasties! [The arguments seems to be this: "But how can these products of decadent times compare with the flourishing (practice itself!) of the Three Dynasties."]

Or, si l'on prise le Shijing et le Chunqiu parce qu'ils représentent le dao de lantiquité, [§§The interpretation of this line as a conditional, as the French has it, seems essential to the argument, and it is overlooked in the English translation.
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [缺"That where there is a failure of the Way to prevail" is neither deficiency nor deteriorisation.]

ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [is inferior to where there is a complete realisation of the Way.] [顧通 gives up on literary translation and launches into an independent free elaboration that does not address the text.]
Or, si l'on prise le Shijing et le Chunqiu parce qu'ils représentent le dao de lantiquité,
il fut une époque plus ancienne encore où le Shijing et le Chunqiu n'avaient pas encore été écrits.
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"(a Way) that failed to prevail (at an earlier stage)" .]

ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [其全 "(a Way) that covers all/is comprehensive] [顧通 gives up on literary translation and launches into an independent free elaboration that does not address the text.]
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"(a Way) that failed to prevail (at an earlier stage)" .

Comment pourraient ils égaler la plénitude des trois dynasties! [The arguments seems to be this: "But how can these Confucians with the unchanging and uncritical cultivation of those ancient objects compare with the Three Dynasties and their willingness to change and to adapt to new situations.]
Or, si l'on prise le Shijing et le Chunqiu parce qu'ils représentent le dao de lantiquité, 許匡一：《诗》和《春秋》虽然是学问中的上品，
il fut une époque plus ancienne encore où le Shijing et le Chunqiu n'avaient pas encore été écrits. 但都是反映衰世的作品，
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"(a Way) that failed to prevail (at an earlier stage)" . 儒家用它们来教导世人，]

ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [其全 "(a Way) that covers all/is comprehensive] [顧通 gives up on literary translation and launches into an independent free elaboration that does not address the text.]
il fut une époque plus ancienne encore où le Shijing et le Chunqiu n'avaient pas encore été écrits. 那么还有比产生《诗》、《春秋》更古的时代呢。
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"(a Way) that failed to prevail (at an earlier stage)" . 与其称道反映王道残破的《诗》、《春秋》，

ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [其全 "(a Way) that covers all/is comprehensive] [許匡一：不如称道更早的三王盛世的政绩。 顧通 gives up on literary translation and launches into an independent free elaboration that does not address the text.]
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"the period when the Way failed to prevail" . 許匡一：与其称道反映王道残破的《诗》、《春秋》，
ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [其全 "the period when the Way was completely present] [許匡一：不如称道更早的三王盛世的政绩。
Ainsi, l'époque où le dao se déteriore [其缺"the period when the Way was defective" . 許匡一：与其称道反映王道残破的《诗》、《春秋》，
ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [其全 "the period when the Way was completely realised] [許匡一：不如称道更早的三王盛世的政绩。
réciter les écrits des premiers rois [DC Lau omits the 詩 which is missing in many early editions.]

réciter les écrits des premiers rois [§§§§§§先王 "the early/first kings" are misunderstood as any "former kings" in the English. §§§§§ 先王之詩書 "the DC Lau omits the 詩 which is missing in many early editions.]

réciter les écrits des premiers rois [§§§§§§先王 "the early/first kings" are misunderstood as any "former kings" in the English. §§§§§ 先王之書 "the 尚書 from/about the early kings. 許匡一：王念孙认为＂《诗》”是衍文。 DC Lau omits the 詩 which is missing in many early editions.]
ne vaut pas celle où le dao était intact. [道其全 "orientating one's way from the period when the Way was completely realised.] [許匡一：不如称道更早的三王盛世的政绩。

ne vaut pas d'atteindre la source de leurs paroles; [§§§§§其所以言"that which motivated their speech" is not just their subject or "that about which they spoke". ne vaut pas d'atteindre la source de leurs paroles; [§§§§§其所以言"that which motivated their speech" is not just their subject or "that about which they spoke". The English translation does not address the grammar of the sentence. 其所以言 (which is, of course, quite different from 所言 which COULD come to mean "that about which they spoke".]

cette source, [§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "If one grasps what makes them speak, then one is unable to express this with words."]

cette source, [§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "If one grasps what makes them speak, then one is unable to express this with words."] 劉康德：与其听他们的言论，不如了解他们说这些言

cette source, [§§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "If one grasps what makes them speak, then one is unable to express this with words."] 劉康德 also addresses the grammatical structure, as does the French：与其听他们的言论，不如了解他们说这些言论的根据理由。
la parole ne peut l'exprimer. [高注 goes on beautifully：口不能以言。 §§The English "speaking cannot speak it" gets the sense but sound outlandish.]

cette source, [§§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "One who grasps what makes them speak, will then still be unable to express this with words."] 劉康德 also addresses the grammatical structure, as does the French：与其听他们的言论，不如了解他们说这些言论的根据理由。

cette source, [§§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "One who grasps what made them speak, will then still be unable to express this with words."] 劉康德 also addresses the grammatical structure, as does the French：与其听他们的言论，不如了解他们说这些言论的根据理由。

cette source, [§§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "One who grasps what made them speak, will then still be unable to express this(弗能言) with words." The initial 言 is apparently "by the use of words".] 劉康德 also addresses the grammatical structure, as does the French：

ne vaut pas d'atteindre la source de leurs paroles; [§§§§§其所以言"that which motivated their speech" is not just their subject or "that about which they spoke". The English translation does not address the grammar of the sentence. 其所以言 (which is, of course, quite different from 所言 which COULD come to mean "that about which they spoke". 許匡一：；听三王说的话，不如得知他们说话的根据。]

ne vaut pas d'atteindre la source de leurs paroles; [§§§§§其所以言"that which motivated their speech" is not just their subject or "that about which they spoke". The English translation does not address the grammar of the sentence. 其所以言 (which is, of course, quite different from 所言 which COULD come to mean "that about which they spoke". 許匡一：；听三王说的话，不如得知他们说话的根据。劉康德 also addresses the grammatical structure, as does the French：与其听他们的言论，不如了解他们说这些言论的根据理由。

cette source, [§§§§§其所以言 is again seriously misconstrued by "about which they spoke" in the English. 高注：聖人所言微妙，凡人雖得之，I think, literally it has to go like this: "One who grasps what made them speak, will then still be unable to express this(弗能言) with words." The initial 言 is apparently "by the use of words".]
la parole ne peut l'exprimer. [高注 goes on beautifully：口不能以言。"he cannot express it with his mouth (with spoken words." §§The English "speaking cannot speak it" gets the sense but sound outlandish.]

la parole ne peut l'exprimer. [高注 goes on beautifully：口不能以言。"he cannot express it with his mouth (with spoken words." §§The English "speaking cannot speak it" gets the sense but sound outlandish. I think, literally it has to go like this: "One who grasps what made them speak, will then still be unable to express this(弗能言) with words." The initial 言 is apparently "by the use of words". ]
le dao qu'on saurait exprimer
il ne décidait de sa propre autorité [§§專"on one's own authority" is an impermissible mode for those acting as subjects. The "encroached" in the English does not capture the semantics of this.]
et n'entreprenait rien par lui-même.
Ses vêtements semblaient trop lourds pour son corps, [§§§§衣"garments" is not captured well by "regalia".]
Ses vêtements semblaient trop lourds pour son corps, [§§衣"(ritual) garments" is not captured well by "regalia".]
et ses paroles semblaient ne point parvenir à sortir de sa bouche. [§不出"would not emerge" is dynamic and is captured much better in the French.]
et ses paroles semblaient ne point parvenir à sortir de sa bouche. [§不出"would not emerge" is dynamic and is captured much better in the French than in "did not emanate".]
et risquait de commettre une erreur. [恐"be afraid to" is not "risquait". Here the French is carelessly inexact and the English notices the important wider scope of 如"as if".

mit en pratique les codes du fils du Ciel, [履籍"act on the administrative records/documents of state (of/for the Son of Heaven)" would seem to construe royal governance as based on written documentation. But this interpretation remains highly speculative. HSWZ suggests an easier reading which the English version reasonably opts for. 韓詩外傳作「履天子之位，驄天下之政」，尤爲明證矣。 Elsewhere in the same chapter below the same phrase is translated as "He compiled the land registers of the Son of Heaven"]

mit en pratique les codes du fils du Ciel, [§§§§§履籍"act on the administrative records/documents of state (of/for the Son of Heaven)" would seem to construe royal governance as based on written documentation. But this interpretation remains speculative. HSWZ suggests an easier reading which the English version reasonably opts for. 韓詩外傳作「履天子之位，驄天下之政」，尤爲明證矣。 Elsewhere in the same chapter below the same phrase is translated as "He compiled the land registers of the Son of Heaven"]
et dirigea le gouvernement. [§§政"administration" is not 治"government". 聽"attend to" involves active participation in the decision-making, not supervision.]
Il châtia et récompensa, contrôla et trancha, [§§§§§制斷"established administrative rules and made decisions" is the most important part of this sentence and is not translated.]
On peut dire qu'il savait être martial. [Second role: administrative and military leader.]
Il n'agissait qu'après avoir demandé la permission,
Il n'agissait qu'après avoir demandé la permission,
et la redemandait avant de poursuivre.
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions.
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions. [§§§
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions. [§§§伐矜“bragging, selfassertion" is subtly different from pride.
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions. [§§§伐矜“bragging, self-assertion" is subtly different from pride.
aucune apparence de vouloir s'attribuer la mérite de ses actions. [§§§伐矜“bragging, boasting, bluster" is subtly different from pride.
